articles.title: About this site
articles.contents:
This site was built by Hannah Koenker, Technical Director at Tropical Health. Both Stata and R were used for analysis and presentation of the findings.

Methods

Publicly available datasets were downloaded from dhsprogram.com and mics.unicef.org. Appropriate survey weights were applied using the “svy” command in Stata and the “survey” package in R. Regression results for the maps on the homepage were run with the svy: logistic command in Stata; those in the reports were run with the svyglm command in R, using a quasi-binomial specification.

articles.title: ITN Textile vs ITN Use
articles.description:
Does the textile of an ITN make a difference in the overall use rate?
Last update: `r format(Sys.time(), '%d %B, %Y')`
articles.contents:
This website provides reports for countries in sub-Saharan Africa to evaluate whether there are differences in use of insecticide-treated nets (ITNs) due to the textile of ITNs (i.e. polyester or polyethylene).
Some countries may wish to procure ITNs of a particular textile. These reports use large household survey data to evaluate whether there are differences in use between polyester and polyethylene nets in a particular country, and whether net textile is associated with these differences after controlling for other determinants of net use.
These reports walk through several key questions to ask as we consider this question and provide recommendations for next steps.
This work is supported by the Alliance for Malaria Prevention with funding from The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.

articles.title: Reports
articles.description:
Reports are limited to the most recent Malaria Indicator Survey or Demographic and Health Survey for each country. They are available in English and in French.
